headline: Toll Brothers, Eli Lilly, Amazon & Intuit: After-Hours Movers
summary: Asking for a Trend's Josh Lipton checks out the top trending stocks in the after-hours trading session. Toll Brothers (TOL) stock slips despite topping fiscal fourth quarter estimates. Pharma giant Eli Lilly (LLY) announces a $15 billion share buyback program. Amazon (AMZN) is partnering with Intuit QuickBooks (INTU) to allow its third-party sellers access to their sales and inventory data on the program. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Why Advanced Micro Devices Plunged Today
summary: Shares of chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) fell 5.4% in Monday trading, as of 2 p.m. ET.  The semiconductor stock fell today on the heels of an analyst downgrade from a Wall Street sell-side analyst, capping off a difficult few trading days for the artificial intelligence (AI) hopeful.  Today, Bank of America analyst Vivek Arya downgraded AMD to neutral from buy, while lowering his price target from $180 to $155.

Today, Bank of America analyst Vivek Arya downgraded AMD to neutral from buy, while lowering his price target from $180 to $155.

headline: Mag 7 'not critical' for market success in 2025: Strategist
summary: While Bloomberg Intelligence is forecasting the Magnificent Seven's earnings growth — Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — to drop from 2024's 34% to 18% in 2025, will the group of tech stocks be as pivotal for the S&P 500 (^GSPC) in the new year? "They're obviously important for the market, but they're not critical for the market's success. And we see signs that earnings growth is set to broaden out as we head into 2025," J.P. Morgan Private Bank US Head of Investment Strategy Jake Manoukian tells Seana Smith and Brad Smith on the Morning Brief. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. ]This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

"They're obviously important for the market, but they're not critical for the market's success. And we see signs that earnings growth is set to broaden out as we head into 2025," J.P. headline: Omnicom to Acquire Interpublic in Deal That Will Reshape Advertising Industry
summary: Omnicom  Group will acquire  Interpublic Group  in a deal that will create the world’s largest advertising business, the companies confirmed Monday.  A combined entity would have net revenue of more than $20 billion, based on 2023 figures for each company, and include storied ad agencies such as TBWA Worldwide and McCann Worldgroup.  The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday that the companies were in advanced merger talks.

raw.headline: Omnicom to Acquire Interpublic in Deal That Will Reshape Advertising Industry

A combined entity would have net revenue of more than $20 billion, based on 2023 figures for each company, and include storied ad agencies such as TBWA Worldwide and McCann Worldgroup.  The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday that the companies were in advanced merger talks.

headline: Amazon should buy Bitcoin, shareholders say
summary: Shareholders of Amazon (AMZN) have submitted a proposal to add Bitcoin to the balance sheet. The shareholders of the e-commerce giant are urging the company to learn from MicroStrategy (MSTR), which heavily invested in Bitcoin, resulting in an increase in its share price.

headline: Mag 7's profit growth forecasted to slow in 2025: Bloomberg
summary: As the S&P 500's (^GSPC) Magnificent Seven — Meta Platforms (META) Microsoft (MSFT) Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — could see its profit growth slow from 34% to 18% in 2025, Bloomberg Intelligence reports the healthcare sector could take the lead. Yahoo Finance host Madison Mills joins the Morning Brief to break down Bloomberg Intelligence's latest earnings growth estimates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: The Best Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy With $500 Right Now
summary: Investors often look to Warren Buffett for stock ideas and wisdom about the market, hoping to glean any insights they can from his decades of success as the longtime CEO of Berkshire Hathaway and his management of a $300 billion portfolio.  If you have $500 to spend right now, there are some good reasons to put that money toward two stocks in Buffett's portfolio: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and American Express (NYSE: AXP).  Amazon's stock belongs in nearly any investor's portfolio for a couple of good reasons.

headline: India antitrust body seeks Supreme Court hearing to expedite Amazon, Flipkart cases
summary: India's antitrust body has asked the Supreme Court to hear legal challenges to an investigation of Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart e-commerce platforms, saying those challenges, filed by Samsung, Vivo and others at Indian high courts, were aiming to scuttle the probe.  In a filing on Dec. 3, reviewed by Reuters and not released publicly, the Competition Commission of India asked the court to hear 23 challenges, filed by Samsung, Vivo, and several vendors on the Amazon and Flipkart platforms, to enable the case to be decided quickly.

raw.headline: India antitrust body seeks Supreme Court hearing to expedite Amazon, Flipkart cases
raw.summary: India's antitrust body has asked the Supreme Court to hear legal challenges to an investigation of Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart e-commerce platforms, saying those challenges, filed by Samsung, Vivo and others at Indian high courts, were aiming to scuttle the probe.  In a filing on Dec. 3, reviewed by Reuters and not released publicly, the Competition Commission of India asked the court to hear 23 challenges, filed by Samsung, Vivo, and several vendors on the Amazon and Flipkart platforms, to enable the case to be decided quickly.

headline: What’s New in the Rankings of Best-Managed Companies for 2024
summary: One way to judge how satisfied consumers are with a company’s products or services is to ask them—opinions typically gleaned by conducting surveys or convening panels.  Devised by the research firm ROI Rocket, this new metric, a “digital positioning score,” looks at the amount of activity a company realizes over time, as compared with its industry peers, across four channels: search, traffic on its website (or sites), social media and any apps it has.  When things are popping online, it’s “indicative of how people view a brand,” says Rod Fertig, ROI Rocket’s chief data officer.

raw.headline: What’s New in the Rankings of Best-Managed Companies for 2024
raw.summary: One way to judge how satisfied consumers are with a company’s products or services is to ask them—opinions typically gleaned by conducting surveys or convening panels.  Devised by the research firm ROI Rocket, this new metric, a “digital positioning score,” looks at the amount of activity a company realizes over time, as compared with its industry peers, across four channels: search, traffic on its website (or sites), social media and any apps it has.  When things are popping online, it’s “indicative of how people view a brand,” says Rod Fertig, ROI Rocket’s chief data officer.
